For some integer n, the odd integer is represented in the form of:
questions.explanation: Since 2n represents the even numbers, hence 2n + 1 will always represent the odd numbers.

questions.question: HCF of 26 and 91 is:
questions.explanation: The prime factorisation of 26 and 91 is; 26 = 2 x 13, 91 = 7 x 13. Hence, HCF (26, 91) = 13

questions.question: Which of the following is not irrational?
The addition of a rational number and an irrational number is equal to:
questions.explanation: The addition of a rational number and an irrational number is equal to an irrational number.

questions.question: The multiplication of two irrational numbers is:
questions.explanation: The multiplication of two irrational numbers may result in a rational or irrational number.

questions.question: If set A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5,…} is given, then it represents:
questions.explanation: If set A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5,…} is given, then it represents natural numbers.

questions.question: If p and q are integers and is represented in the form of p/q, then it is a:
questions.explanation: If p and q are integers and is represented in the form of p/q, then it is a rational number.
